flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Characters are the reason we read stories; emotion drives fiction, nonfiction, and poetry alike. Representations of strong characters or emotions are the reason stories exist. The central idea is to create realistic and believable characters who compel the readers to connect with them on an emotional level. Travel into a character’s thoughts and express them with words and pictures. The only importance of the backdrop and setting of a story is to give us more perspective on a character and should not be the focus of a story. Capture a strong bond with your characters and make them real.
